question: Which of the following group represents right combination of Triratnas of Jainism?
option1: Right Faith, Right Knowledge, Right Thought
option2: Right Thought, Right Action, Right Conduct
option3: Right Faith, Right Knowledge , Right Conduct
answer: Right Faith, Right Knowledge , Right Conduct
explanation: The triratnas are the three jewels (also referred to as ratnatraya) are understood as samyagdarshana (“right faith”), samyagjnana (“right knowledge”), and samyakcharitra (“right conduct”). One of the three cannot exist exclusive of the others, and all are required for spiritual liberation.
